content:
It would be difficult for modern linguists to decipher modern attempts at employing the Native American code talker strategy, as the codes used by the code talkers were highly specialized and relied on the use of unique and specific terminology and phrasing. The codes were not simply a direct translation of the English language into the Native American language, but rather a complex system of substitution and encryption that was designed to be difficult to decode.

Furthermore, many of the Native American languages used by the code talkers are relatively obscure and not widely studied by linguists or others outside of the communities where they are spoken. This means that even if a linguist were able to analyze the language used in the code, they may not have enough knowledge of the language to fully decipher the meaning of the messages.

Overall, while modern linguists may be able to analyze the languages used by the code talkers and gain some understanding of the basic structure and syntax of the language, it would be difficult to fully decipher the codes used by the code talkers without extensive knowledge of the specific terminology and phrasing used in the codes.
